item.title: An Integral Equation Arising from Time-Consistent Portfolio Selection
item.description: arXiv:2412.02446v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: This paper discusses a nonlinear integral equation arising from a class of time-consistent portfolio selection problem. We propose a unified framework requiring minimal assumptions, such as right-continuity of market coefficients and square-integrability of the market price of risk. Our main contribution is proving the existence and uniqueness of the square-integrable solution for the integral equation under mild conditions. Illustrative applications include the mean-variance portfolio selection and the utility maximization with random risk aversion.
item.dc:creator: Zongxia Liang, Sheng Wang, Jianming Xia
